unit_learning_outcomes.description: Prepare independent academic research in the field.
Communicate disciplinary knowledge using appropriate academic discourses.
Analyse contemporary ethical implications of media and communications representations.
Analyse how media and communication is shaped by and shapes social, cultural, historical, political and economic processes.
Evaluate and distinguish between foundational frameworks and approaches to media audiences, technologies, industries, and practices.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Completing set readings for the Unit.
Completing the before and after class activities

assessments.description: Students are required to complete two quizzes.The quizzes may cover any of the topics studied until the date on which the quiz is held.
Students are required to write a complete Mini Essay, including references. Students will use teacher feedback on this task to write their Major Essay.
Incorporating the feedback provided by their teacher, students are required to write a Major Essay expanding and improving on their Mini Essay .
Students will be assessed on their preparedness, productive participation in group activities, and thoughtful contributions to class discussions throughout the term.

data.subject_search_title: WMMC1040 - Introduction to Media and Mass Communications
data.description: Introduction to media and communications addresses the major transformations and continuities in the media and communications environment. Students learn foundational frameworks that will help them gain a deeper understanding of rapidly changing media industries and practices. Through interdisciplinary, international, and historical frameworks, this unit explores a range of media forms from print, photography, cinema, and broadcast media, to digital technologies and practices. Through the analysis of mediated communications and media change, students develop knowledge of the structures of power that inform complex relationships between audiences and producers. By interrogating the role of media in everyday life, in both local and global contexts, the unit offers a vital introduction to media and communications studies.
